page.title: 17Muirland School, Arden 2
page.content: At present the school has ten pupils and one teacher. It is held in the new building. There is a part-time secretary and janitor. Most children are brought to school by the education authority car. The school is now heated by electricity and hot dinners are brought from Helensburgh. The minister and local policeman visit the school regularly. The children go swimming in Helensburgh every Friday. A Library van calls once a fortnight and a music teacher visits the school. The school has a computer.Physical Education and dinners are taken in the old school. This building is also used by the playgroup which meets twice a week. In the winter sewing and dancing classes are held in the school in the evenings. This survey has been compiled by the present pupils of the school.Primary 1-7.June 1985.
